author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 54-year-old man was clubbed to death by a motorist after an argument broke out between the two in Kodungaiyur on Wednesday evening.

According to police, A. Sekar of Kamaraj Salai in Kodungaiyur, a grocery store owner, was riding on Narayanasamy Garden Fifth Street in Kodungaiyur, when he was hit by another motorcyclist with a woman riding pillion.

An argument broke out between the two and in a fit of rage, the other motorcyclist picked up a log and hit Sekar on his head.

“When he fell unconscious, the motorcyclist and the woman sped away,” a policeman said.

Sekar was taken to a clinic nearby, where he was pronounced dead on arrival. His body was later sent to Stanley Medical College Hospital for post-mortem.

A case has been registered and a search is on for the motorcyclist and the woman.

Two killed in accidents

Two people were killed in separate accidents in the city on Tuesday. A pedestrian, Akilandam (84), died after she was hit by a motorcyclist near her house on Boag Road in T. Nagar on Tuesday evening. She succumbed to her injuries at the hospital. Police arrested Sateesh (29), the motorcyclist.

In another accident, Ravi Balakrishnan (33), who was returning home from work was killed on the spot after he was hit by a vehicle at Pattabhiram on Wednesday. Police are yet to trace out the vehicle and its driver.
title: Man clubbed to death by motorcyclist
